properties.name: Cape Canaveral
properties.description: Posted by Jesusfreak7980 North Atlantic Ave, Cape Canaveral, FloridaCape Canaveral, also known as John F. Kennedy Space Center, is the NASA site where they send off all of the rockets into space. Cape Canaveral is 34 miles long and approximately six miles wide covering over 219 square miles. A total of 13,500 people work at the site as of 2008. Cape Canaveral is a tourist place in Florida. It has a vistiors center and public tours which allow visitors to go and get up close to the shuttles. You can ride simulators to feel what is like to be an astronaut. In addition to NASA, Cape Canaveral is known for a location that many cruise lines port.

properties.name: Chimney Rock Park
properties.description: Posted by JesusfreakHighway 64/74A, Chimney Rock, North CarolinaChimney Rock is an awesome climbing rock within Chimney Rock Park. This is a state park outside the city of Hendersonville, North Carolina. There are so many things to do there. You can do more than 10 walking trails, sit on cliffs, slide down slick rocks or go into a gift shop and restaurant. The trails go from easy to difficult. Every climbing location has guard rails so that you don\'t fall off the steep cliffs. You can also swim in a 404 foot waterfall or climb another mountain called Devil\'s Head.

properties.name: Disney World
properties.description: Posted by JesusfreakLake Buena Vista, Orlando, FL 32830Walt Disney World is the most visited and largest resort in the world containing four theme parks, two water parks, and many shopping, dining and entertainment areas. Walt Disney World opened on October 1, 1971 with the Magic Kingdom. The four symbols of Walt Disney World are Cinderella\'s Castle at the Magic Kingdom, the Scorcerer\'s Hat at Disney Studios, Spaceship Earth at EPCOT and the Tree of Life at Animal Kingdom. When the Magic Kingdom opened in 1971, Walt Disney World employed 5,500 cast members. Today, Walt Disney World employs more than 61,000 cast members. It is the largest single site employer in the United States.

properties.name: Eiffel  Tower
properties.description: Posted by Jesusfreak5 Avenue Antole, Paris, FranceThe Eiffel Tower is one of the most recognizable structures in the world. Named after its designer, Gustave Eiffel, it is the tallest building in Paris. The antenna is 1,063 feet high which is equivalent to about 81 levels in a business building. In 1889 it was the tallest tower until 1930 when New York City\'s Chrysler Building was completed. Tourists can either walk the thousands of stairs to reach the top of the tower or take two sets of elevators. Many local people go to the Eiffel Tower to eat at the restaurant which has a great view of the city of Paris.

properties.name: Golden Gate Bridge
properties.description: Posted by JesusfreakU.S Highway 101, San Franscio, CaliforniaThe Golden Gate Bridge is a bridge spanning across the San Franscio Bay to Marin County, CA. The Golden Gate Bridge had the longest suspension bridge span in the world when it was completed in 1937. It has become one of the most recognized symbols of San Franscio and the U.S. Since its completion the span length has been surpassed by eight different bridges,but it still has the second longest suspension bridge in the U.S.

properties.name: Mall of America
properties.description: Posted by JesusfreakÂ 60 E Broadway, Bloomington, MNMall of America is a super shopping located in Minnesota. In the U.S. it is the third largest enclosed mall. Opened in 1992, the mall received 40 million visitors by 2006. The Mall of America is the only mall in the United States that has a full theme park in it. This theme park used to be "Camp Snoopy" and was recently changed to be a "Nickelodeon" theme park.

properties.name: Space Needle
properties.description: Posted by Jesusfreak400 Broad St., Seattle, WA, United States The Space Needle is a major landmark of Seattle. It was built for the 1962 World\'s Fair. The Space Needle is 605 feet high and 138 feet wide. When it was completed it was the tallest building west of the Mississippi River. It is built to withstand winds of up to 200 mph and earthquakes up to 9.5 magnituides. It also has 25 lightimg rods on the roof to prevent lighting damage. From the observation deck the tourists can see not only Downtown Seattle, but they can also see the Olympic and Cascade Mountains, Mount Rainer, Mount Baker and Eliot Bay. The Space Needle features a restaurant which spins 180 degrees.

properties.name: St. Louis Arch
properties.description: Posted by Jesusfreak707 North 1st St. #1, St. Louis Missouri,63102The St. Louis Gateway Arch was designed by architect Ero Saarinen. The stainless steel structure rises 630 feet high from a 60 foot foundation and spans 630 feet at ground level. The curve sways 1/2-1 in 20 mph wind. The construction started in 1961. The arch didn\'t open to the public until 1966. Vistiors can take trams inside the arch from the bottom all the away to the top to the observation room. The St. Louis arch is the most recognized symbol within the city of St. Louis and maybe even in the whole mid-west.

properties.name: The Alamo
properties.description: Posted by Jesusfreak300 Alamo Plaza, San Antonio,TexasThe Alamo was a battle that took place in San Antonio, Texas in February and March of 1836. The battle was between the Republic of Mexico and Texans. The 13 day war started February 23,1836 and ended March 6,1836. In 1821, the Mexican War for indpendence severed Spain\'s control over it\'s North American Territories. Mexico finally adopted a aconstitution in 1824. Then Texas became part of a newly created state, Coahuahua y Tejas. The Alamo has become the #1 tourist destination in San Antonio, TX. When tourist arrive at the Alamo they are often surprised that the Alamo is not very big compared with the stories that have been told about the Alamo.

properties.name: The London Eye
properties.description: Posted by JesusfreakCounty Hall Belvedere Road London SE1 7PBThe London Eye is the tallest Ferris Wheel in Europe. It is 443 feet tall. "The Eye" as it is often called, has become the most popular paid tourist attraction in the United Kingdom. Over 3 million people a year visit it. The wheel carries 32 passenger capsules attached to the wheel. The Eye sits next to the river and directly across the street from many old London tourist attractions, like Big Ben. The Eye is a great way to see all of London from the air and understand how the city was designed.
